intro: Pultenaea quaerita, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bush vicia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Pultenaea quaerita is a hardy shrub that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
